did.unittitle: Langston Hughes, New York, to Mrs. Ina Steele, Maryland State College, Princess Anne, Maryland

scopecontent.p: [regrets that he does not know anyone who meets the teaching requirements mentioned by Mrs. Steele, mentions his work on getting two large books to press, A Pictorial History of the Negro in Americaand his autobiography I Wonder As I Wanderwhich prevented him from answering her letter sooner, and hopes to see her this summer]

did.unittitle: Langston Hughes, New York, to Mrs. Ina Steele

scopecontent.p: [furnishes many details of his celebration of the Christmas season and gifts he received, his trip to California to visit his Uncle Johnny and his return home on his first jet plane; mentions missing the Harry BelafonteTV show because he had a speaking engagement in Connecticut the same night; describes a bullfight bar owned by Barnaby Conradwhich he visited a year ago; thanks her for her present of wax matches; and mentions Josephine Bakerwho "is now reading Tambourines to Gloryand the Theatre Guildis hoping she might be our leading lady, with Odettafor the other main role. We'll see! I only believe such things when they actually happen."]
